item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "He did not want to play. He wanted to meet in the real world the unsubstantial image which his soul so constantly beheld. He did not know where to seek it or how, but a premonition which led him on told him that this image would, without any overt act of his, encounter him. They would meet quietly as if they had known each other and had made their tryst, perhaps at one of the gates or in some more secret place. They would be alone, surrounded by darkness and silence: and in that moment of supreme tenderness he would be transfigured. He would fade into something impalpable under her eyes and then in a moment he would be transfigured. Weakness and timidity and inexperience would fall from him in that magic moment." -- James Joyce

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "I keep coming back to you in my head, but you couldn't know that, and I have no carbons" -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "I am all in a sea of wonders. I doubt; I fear; I think strange things, which I dare not confess to my own soul. God keep me, if only for the sake of those dear to me!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books ..is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Chance encounters are what keep us going." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "What harbor can receive you more securely than a great library?" -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jenny (Reading Envy) add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Literature is no one’s private ground, literature is common ground; let us trespass freely and fearlessly and find our own way for ourselves." -- Virginia Woolf
